data.text: O God, enable me, the king whom you appointed in Israel, to rule justly.
in order that I will judge your people fairly,
I desire that all over the country—even on the hills and mountains [DOU]—
Help me, your king, to defend the poor people
I desire that your people will revere you as long as the moon shines, forever.
I desire that my rule will be enjoyed by the people [SIM]
I hope/desire that people will live righteously during the years that I rule,
I hope/desire that the kings of Israel will rule the people
I hope/desire that those who live in the desert will bow down before them,
I hope/desire that the kings of Spain and of the islands in the Mediterranean Sea will bring ◄tribute money/taxes► to the kings of Israel,
I hope/desire that all the other kings in the world will bow before the kings of Israel,
They will rescue poor people when they ◄cry out/plead► for help,
They will pity those who are weak and needy;
Our kings will rescue the people from being oppressed and from being treated cruelly,
I hope/desire that our kings will live a long time!
I hope/desire that the fields will produce plenty of grain everywhere, even on the tops of the hills in the land where they rule,
I desire that the names of our kings will never be forgotten.
Praise Yahweh, the God whom we Israelis worship;
Praise him forever!
That is the end of this group of prayers/songs written by David, the son of Jesse.
